definition: Pearl S. Buck (1892-1973), American writer known for her novels on Asian cultures, Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize laureate
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: In her foreword, Spurling dates her fascination with Buck to her childhood reading.
sentences.chinese: 在前言中，斯普林提到，她從童年起就被賽珍珠吸引。

sentences.english: In the third chapter, the thesis author analyses Pearl Buck's formation of feminism.
sentences.chinese: 第三章則分析了賽珍珠女性觀的成因。

sentences.english: Pearls Sydenstricker Buck is one of few female Nobel Prize winner.
sentences.chinese: 賽珍珠是爲數不多的女性諾貝爾文學獎獲得者。

sentences.english: Of course things have moved on since Buck’s day.
sentences.chinese: 當然，從賽珍珠的時代以來，事情一直在變化。

sentences.english: Buck insisted that our grandparents’ world belongs also to us.
sentences.chinese: 賽珍珠堅持說，我們祖輩的世界也屬於我們。
